overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a detailed analysis of a 96-hour time-series forecasting task for transformer load data. The approach focuses on identifying patterns in limited data (4 days), handling day-of-week effects, and developing a practical heuristic method when advanced models are constrained by data scarcity. The reasoning is thorough, emphasizing data completeness checks, seasonality detection, and pragmatic solutions for weekly pattern extrapolation.
key_insights: Prioritized daily seasonality over weekly patterns due to limited data (only 4 days)
Used last observed weekend day (Saturday) as proxy for forecasting Sunday
Averaged weekday patterns (Wed-Fri) for Monday-Wednesday forecasts
Addressed data scarcity constraints by simplifying model complexity
Validated absence of missing values in the provided 96-point window
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines statistical pattern recognition with heuristic adaptations. Includes multi-step validation (trend analysis, seasonality detection, anomaly checks) but simplifies implementation due to data limitations.
